metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: HTML Image Maps
With HTML image maps, you can create clickable areas on an image.
content.html: With HTML image maps, you can create clickable areas on an image.

content.text: Image Maps
The HTML <map> tag defines an image map. An image map is an image with clickable areas. The areas are defined with one or more <area> tags.
content.html: The HTML <map> tag defines an image map. An image map is an image with clickable areas. The areas are defined with one or more <area> tags.

content.text: Try to click on the computer, phone, or the cup of coffee in the image below:
content.html: Try to click on the computer, phone, or the cup of coffee in the image below:

content.code_html:
<img src="workplace.jpg" alt="Workplace" usemap="#workmap">

<map name="workmap">
  <area shape="rect" coords="34,44,270,350" alt="Computer" href="computer.htm">
  <area shape="rect" coords="290,172,333,250" alt="Phone" href="phone.htm">
  <area shape="circle" coords="337,300,44" alt="Coffee" href="coffee.htm">
</map>

content.text: How Does it Work?
The idea behind an image map is that you should be able to perform different actions depending on where in the image you click.
content.html: The idea behind an image map is that you should be able to perform different actions depending on where in the image you click.

content.text: To create an image map you need an image, and some HTML code that describes the clickable areas.
content.html: To create an image map you need an image, and some HTML code that describes the clickable areas.

content.text: The Image
The image is inserted using the tag. The only difference from other images is that you must add a usemap attribute:
content.html: The image is inserted using the <img> tag. The only difference from other images is that you must add a usemap attribute:

content.code_html: <img src="workplace.jpg" alt="Workplace" usemap="#workmap">

content.text: The usemap value starts with a hash tag # followed by the name of the image map, and is used to create a relationship between the image and the image map.
content.html: The usemap value starts with a hash tag # followed by the name of the image map, and is used to create a relationship between the image and the image map.

content.text: Tip: You can use any image as an image map!
content.html: Tip: You can use any image as an image map!

content.text: Create Image Map
Then, add a <map> element.
content.html: Then, add a <map> element.

content.text: The <map> element is used to create an image map, and is linked to the image by using the required name attribute:
content.html: The <map> element is used to create an image map, and is linked to the image by using the required name attribute:

content.code_html: <map name="workmap">

content.text: The name attribute must have the same value as the 's usemap attribute .
content.html: The name attribute must have the same value as the <img>'s usemap attribute .

content.text: The Areas
Then, add the clickable areas.
content.html: Then, add the clickable areas.

content.text: A clickable area is defined using an <area> element.
content.html: A clickable area is defined using an <area> element.

content.text: Shape
You must define the shape of the clickable area, and you can choose one of these values:
content.html: You must define the shape of the clickable area, and you can choose one of these values:

content.text: You must also define some coordinates to be able to place the clickable area onto the image.
content.html: You must also define some coordinates to be able to place the clickable area onto the image.

content.text: Shape="rect"
The coordinates for shape="rect" come in pairs, one for the x-axis and one for the y-axis.
content.html: The coordinates for shape="rect" come in pairs, one for the x-axis and one for the y-axis.

content.text: So, the coordinates 34,44 is located 34 pixels from the left margin and 44 pixels from the top:
content.html: So, the coordinates 34,44 is located 34 pixels from the left margin and 44 pixels from the top:

content.text: The coordinates 270,350 is located 270 pixels from the left margin and 350 pixels from the top:
content.html: The coordinates 270,350 is located 270 pixels from the left margin and 350 pixels from the top:

content.text: Now we have enough data to create a clickable rectangular area:
content.html: Now we have enough data to create a clickable rectangular area:

content.code_html: <area shape="rect" coords="34, 44, 270, 350" href="computer.htm">

content.text: This is the area that becomes clickable and will send the user to the page "computer.htm":
content.html: This is the area that becomes clickable and will send the user to the page "computer.htm":

content.text: Shape="circle"
To add a circle area, first locate the coordinates of the center of the circle:
content.html: To add a circle area, first locate the coordinates of the center of the circle:

content.text: Then specify the radius of the circle:
content.html: Then specify the radius of the circle:

content.text: 44 pixels
content.html: 44 pixels

content.text: Now you have enough data to create a clickable circular area:
content.html: Now you have enough data to create a clickable circular area:

content.code_html: <area shape="circle" coords="337, 300, 44" href="coffee.htm">

content.text: This is the area that becomes clickable and will send the user to the page "coffee.htm":
content.html: This is the area that becomes clickable and will send the user to the page "coffee.htm":

content.text: Shape="poly"
The shape="poly" contains several coordinate points, which creates a shape formed with straight lines (a polygon).
content.html: The shape="poly" contains several coordinate points, which creates a shape formed with straight lines (a polygon).

content.text: This can be used to create any shape.
content.html: This can be used to create any shape.

content.text: Like maybe a croissant shape!
content.html: Like maybe a croissant shape!

content.text: How can we make the croissant in the image below become a clickable link?
content.html: How can we make the croissant in the image below become a clickable link?

content.text: We have to find the x and y coordinates for all edges of the croissant:
content.html: We have to find the x and y coordinates for all edges of the croissant:

content.text: The coordinates come in pairs, one for the x-axis and one for the y-axis:
content.html: The coordinates come in pairs, one for the x-axis and one for the y-axis:

content.code_html: <area shape="poly" coords="140,121,181,116,204,160,204,222,191,270,140,329,85,355,58,352,37,322,40,259,103,161,128,147" href="croissant.htm">

content.text: This is the area that becomes clickable and will send the user to the page "croissant.htm":
content.html: This is the area that becomes clickable and will send the user to the page "croissant.htm":

content.text: Image Map and JavaScript
A clickable area can also trigger a JavaScript function.
content.html: A clickable area can also trigger a JavaScript function.

content.text: Add a click event to the <area> element to execute a JavaScript function:
content.html: Add a click event to the <area> element to execute a JavaScript function:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
function 
  myFunction() {  alert("You clicked the coffee cup!");}

content.code:
<map name="workmap">
 
<area shape="circle" coords="337,300,44" 
href="coffee.htm" onclick="myFunction()">
</map>

<script>function 
myFunction() {  alert("You clicked the coffee cup!");}
</script>

syntax_highlighting.text:
function 
  myFunction() {  alert("You clicked the coffee cup!");}

content.code_html:
<map name="workmap">
  <area shape="circle" coords="337,300,44" href="coffee.htm" onclick="myFunction()">
</map>

<script>
function myFunction() {
  alert("You clicked the coffee cup!");
}
</script>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
function 
  myFunction() {  alert("You clicked the coffee cup!");}

content.text: Chapter Summary
Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is a correct HTML element for defining an image map?
content.html: What is a correct HTML element for defining an image map?

metadata.question: What is a correct HTML element for defining an image map?

content.question: What is a correct HTML element for defining an image map?

content.text: HTML Image Tags

content.code_html:
Tag Description
<img> Defines an image
<map> Defines an image map
<area> Defines a clickable area inside an image map
<picture> Defines a container for multiple image resources

content.text: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference .
content.html: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference.
